page.title: 05FARMING PATTERNS
page.content: Five farms in the area have been studied.By some standards all are small,the largest has an area of 321 hectacres and the smallest of the group is 81 hectacres.The names of the families are Gibson,Gibson,Gilchrist, Dixon,Leymour.All of the families in the group have been working the same farm for 60 years and now the second and third generations are incumbents. With the exception of the largest farm, Gibsons, all keep beef cattle for fattening and grow mixed crops,corn,potatoes,turnips and a new crop oil seed rape.The largest farm grows wheat,barley,oats and oil seed rape.All these crops are sold.On the smaller farms some crops such as potatoes,turnips and grass are grown to feed the beef cattle.
